services.email module¶

services.email.conf = ConnectionConfig(MAIL_USERNAME='postmaster@sandbox48d7dc629dcc4ee6b86e9a8d18d0ca10.mailgun.org', MAIL_PASSWORD='46e73d3a30bbc67ce1aa2eeca94c99ffa-fe9cf0a8-f2b5f0eb', MAIL_PORT=587, MAIL_SERVER='smtp.mailgun.org', MAIL_STARTTLS=True, MAIL_SSL_TLS=False, MAIL_DEBUG=0, MAIL_FROM='postmaster@sandbox48d7dc629dcc4ee6b86e9a8d18d0ca10.mailgun.org', MAIL_FROM_NAME='Book of Contacts', TEMPLATE_FOLDER=WindowsPath('D:/NextCloud/3D_NAS_Code/Courses_Python/Storage_Code/python_web/goit-algo-hw-14/src/services/templates'), SUPPRESS_SEND=0, USE_CREDENTIALS=True, VALIDATE_CERTS=True, TIMEOUT=60)¶

This function sends a verification email to the user’s email address.

Parameters: - email (EmailStr): The email address of the user. - username (str): The username of the user. - host (str): The host URL where the email verification link will be used.

Returns: - None

Raises: - ConnectionErrors: If there are any issues with the email connection.

async services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

This function sends a verification email to the user’s email address.

Parameters: - email (EmailStr): The email address of the user. - username (str): The username of the user. - host (str): The host URL where the email verification link will be used.

Returns: - None

Raises: - ConnectionErrors: If there are any issues with the email connection.
